meanings.definition: To look at or examine closely
meanings.sent1: She was eyeballing the painting in the museum.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys eyeballing the intricate details of nature.
meanings.sent3: The detective was eyeballing the suspect with suspicion.
meanings.sent4: The artist was eyeballing the canvas, searching for inspiration.
meanings.sent5: Eyeballing the map, she tried to find the right direction.

meanings.definition: To estimate or measure something visually
meanings.sent1: He was eyeballing the distance to the finish line.
meanings.sent2: She is good at eyeballing the ingredients for a recipe.
meanings.sent3: The tailor was eyeballing the fabric before cutting it.
meanings.sent4: Eyeballing the size of the room, he decided on the furniture layout.
meanings.sent5: Eyeballing the height of the tree, she guessed it to be over ten feet.

meanings.definition: To make a rough or approximate judgment or assessment
meanings.sent1: Without a ruler, she had to eyeball the length of the table.
meanings.sent2: He tends to eyeball the time it takes to complete tasks.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to eyeball the amount of seasoning for the dish.
meanings.sent4: Eyeballing the crowd, she estimated there were at least a hundred people.
meanings.sent5: Eyeballing the price tag, he quickly decided it was too expensive.
